title.rendered: Which MBA course is best for Banking

content.rendered:
For the interest of the potential bankers

So, you have landed here owing to your keen interest in accounts and economics. Being a finance lover, you now want to pursue a course in the same field and don’t know which path to follow. There is an ample number of courses available these days in various sectors. In a world full of competition, you should be very sure about the course you are going to choose.

First, have a quick check whether you are the right candidate for pursuing a banking course or not.

Do you have?

  • Interest in Banking and Finance and the areas related to it.
  • Knowledge of the Investment System.
  • Mathematical aptitude and a clear analytical, logical mind.
  • Accountancy issues solving abilities.
  • Basic skills like communication, leadership, interpersonal skills, and the ability to use computers and other advanced equipment.
  • Ability to work as a team.

If your answer to all the above-written questions is yes, then let us break the suspense for you- MBA in Banking and Finance or MBA in Finance is your go-to option if you want to make a career in banking.

Both fields are in the first place when it comes to choosing banking as a career option. In a developing country, like India, the demand for financial or insurance professionals is ever-increasing as the sector is expanding like anything. When the market is growing up to its full potential, it makes the contemporary scenario a perfect pool to dive into for the skillful and well-qualified management professionals who are trained in finance, accounts, and other fields of the banking sector.

MBA in Finance VS MBA in Finance & Banking – Which is better?

Both the MBA in Banking & Finance and the MBA in Finance prepare students for professions in the financial sector, including financial planning, investment, and corporate finance.

The main distinction between the two programs is that the MBA in Finance is focused on the core financial services sector and aims to fill significant gaps in the market. In order to prepare students for a successful career in the core finance, fintech, and financial services industries, the curriculum is designed on the basis of financial theory and its application.

The MBA in Banking and Financial Services is created to meet the expanding needs of management professionals working in the sector. The program’s goal is to create experts in quality management who are technically and managerially competent. The program’s main goal is to create a comprehensive and integrative management style for the banking and financial services sector.

Things you need to know before entering into the course

Here is the list of career paths, you can choose after completing your education in the field of banking 

  • Commercial Banking
  • Corporate Finance
  • Credit Analysis
  • Equity Research
  • Investment Banking
  • Private Equity & VC
  • Wealth Management

Now let’s come down to the skills you will be able to acquire after your studies 

Financial Reporting & Analysis –

Understanding businesses is a big aspect of finance, and having a solid knowledge of accounting is necessary to achieve that properly. Even while you might not need to know how to create financial statements from scratch, being able to read them and make deductions from them is a valuable ability to have which you will get by doing the course.

Industry/Business Analysis –  

A course in banking will help you learn the industry and business as you will be going through equity reports which will be mainly Initiating Coverage. An IC report will enable you to have a comprehensive analysis of the business and the industries in the market. 

Financial Modeling –

A financial model is a tool that is a part of excel and is used to have a detailed analysis and valuation of the finances. Once a candidate will achieve a degree in Finance or Banking, he can easily build a 3-statement financial model and Discounted cash flow which is an important skill for finance professionals. 

Subjects you will get to study if you take the course in the banking stream-

NMIMS-Your perfect choice for a distance MBA in Banking & Finance

Narsee Monjee is one of the top brands that is offering Distance MBA courses to working professionals. The institute is serving quality education for the last 41 years and has marked its excellence in the market since then. Starting from a basic Institute, NMIMS has now emerged as a well-known brand and is currently serving at 8 different places in India.

The Institute’s Distance MBA course is a perfect choice for those who want to earn while they are studying. The program is recognized by UGC-DEB of India. The Education body was granted Autonomy category I by UGC and is also given A+ accreditation by NAAC.

Top corporates and start-ups in India highly regard and recognize NMIMS Global programs due to the academic rigor, industry-focused curriculum, and rich academic environment. Students from NMIMS Global come from and go on to some of the top 8000+ corporates, SMBs, and start-ups in India as well as abroad. The institute is currently serving more than 1,25,000 students and is having an excellent placement record.MBA in Finance & Banking is divided into four semesters. You can easily get enrolled in the program by sitting in the comfort of your home. By joining the program, you can easily avail yourself of facilities like counseling throughout your program, a free portal, career support after completion, and whatnot.
